title: Popacademic produces German entry for Eurovision Song Contest
text:
Popacademic produces German entry for Eurovision Song Contest
Christoph Oswald ©Laurena Frey
Popacademic produces German entry for Eurovision Song Contest
In 2020 the Eurovision Song Contest had to be cancelled due to the Corona pandemic, this year the ESC will take place on 18, 20 and 22 May at the Ahoy Arena in Rotterdam.
Jendrik Sigwart will compete for Germany. His song " I Don't Feel Hate " was selected by an international jury of 20 experts and a Eurovision jury consisting of 100 people from all over Germany.
The song was produced by Christoph Oswald, who is studying for a Master's degree in Popular Music at the Popakademie with a focus on Producing/Composing Artist.
"I Don't Feel Hate" was released on 25 February 2021 and is already available on all popular streaming and download platforms.
Jendrik Sigwart will perform the song at the ESC final on 22 May 2021. The show will be broadcast live on ARD from 9 pm.
